reviewText: This game is surprisingly linear and constraining for a game about destruction. The limited amount of resources and a timer really don't give you much to work with aside from figuring out the optimal route and sticking to it every playtrough. This is essentially a prettier looking flash game (and not by much). 3/10

reviewText: Demolition, Inc. is a unique real-time strategy that's based on causing complete destruction by using your limited resources or, more accurately, your ol' bag of tricks. You see, you're an alien tasked with levelizing cities and the most efficient way of accomplishing your mission is by sabotaging the everyday life of earthlings. That means laying down oil splates on pavements, placing destructive cows to set off chain reactions and various other tools of chaos. It's fun, challenging and beautiful to look at. Demolition, Inc. will provide you with some quick strategic fun!
voteText: 11 of 12 people (92%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I bought Demolition Inc. on sale after seeing the trailer. It looked like a fun puzzle blow up so I gave it a shot.

What I really liked about the game is the variety you use to destroy what you need to destroy. The goal of the game is to bring down all the buildings in the area and to raise green areas. How you do it though is up to you and the resources you got to do it. What's exceptional to me about video games is the ability to have ENTIRE control (so when I play RTS I want to be able a single unit from FPS stand point or RTS). Demolition INC sort of let's you do that as you can manually control a few cars. The physics engine while jumping a car off a ramp then slamming into 3 buildings while hitting a propane tank is quite fun.

Would I recommend this game as something extremely worth playing? Depends on what you like. If it's on sale I would say buy it for sure.

RATING : 7.0/10


Gameplay	B-	Story / Campaign	C+	Visuals / User Interface	C+	Sounds / Music	C+	Replay-ability	C+	Overall 	C+

reviewText:
This is an alright game.

Nice and simple way of playing it yet makes you think on how best to employ the best strategy to level the buildings with the tools at your disposal and from what you can find around the level itself.

Pretty toonish design of the game adds to the charm of it along with some pretty neat tools to deploy to help destroy the city in as creative a way as possible and makes you consider on where to place said tools for maximum efficency.

Though I do question the physics of the game slightly.  I played one level and crashed 3 cars into a building that was already damaged, yet the building stood firm and defiant and that cost me the level.  Plus having to retry can cause some previous effects from your last try to still be in play and not reset properly after, resulting in the army coming for you straight away.

Also I have  been having crashing issues here and there with the game, so beware of that.

Music though, quite catchy, pretty good and suits the game very well.

As I look at the price currently, it stands at £4.79.  Its a push, but yes its a fair price for it, though get it on sale if possible.  Its a fine game, could be better with more polish and attention, but its workable and it will eat time like no other as you try and find solutions to destroy the target city, so thats a good thing going for it for sure.  Pick it up if you want to try something a bit different thats cheap and a good time killer.

reviewText: This is actually kind of fun. You control an alien tasked with destroying cities, with limited resources. So you place an oil slick here, and explosive there, let a car skid out through this intersection causing that van to smash into that wall and rebound hitting the explosive which knocks over this building which destroys an entire city block.\n\nIt's like a complicated setup of dominoes, only with more wanton destruction and physics. Probably more deaths too, but we won't focus on those.

reviewText:
Way too few content. Fun gameplay gets repetitive and more puzzle-like pretty quickly. The weapons provided aren't really interesting or innovative.

reviewText: What an interesting indy game. I was hoping that this would be something like the old game Blastcorps on the N64 back in the day. It isn't really anything like it, but thats ok. This game forges its own frontier and it does it pretty damn well. Hardware enabled Physics, some fun indy humor, and funny/cute grpahics turn this indy puzzle game into a winner in my book. It isn't very expensive either! If you like puzzles, and you have a decent graphics card, this game is amusing and enjoyable. Pick it up next time it is on sale! ~PR0XIDIAN

reviewText:
I bought Demolition Inc. awhile back on sale for about $2. It has its moments, but as a proper PC title, it lacks imagination and playability. You are constantly limited in regards to the timer, allocated 'weapons/tools', as well as environmental props. Essentially, you need to use the vehicles that are driving around the allocated areas to force them to destroy buildings. This sounds fun, but it fails on a technical level. The limitations set by the devlopers decreases game longevity as there's no point in returning to the game.
In addition, the game areas need to be larger and have more happening. Instead of relying mostly on the vehicles, there should be other items, tools, props, as well as other objectives to use and/or complete. I like to support independent companies, but I only recommend this game if it is on sale.

I hope that with the income raised the developers can create a sequel or another title, which will perfect an already decent idea.

4.5/10.

reviewText: Tries its absolute hardest to be Blast Corps (N64), yet comes short by a terrible camera, buggy-feeling controls, and horrid driving controls. An hour or so of fun (and some aggravation) isn't really terrible for 2,50, though the music can get really grating really fast, that, and i'd rather spend the sum on a tasty fast food or a snack than this, it'll last you longer and doesn't bring any frustration.

reviewText: There's a method to the madness that is Demolition Inc.  You have to use strategy to properly orchestrate the mayhem that you are called upon to inflict upon the cities in this game, using everything from oil slicks, glue, magnets, and exploding cows - yes, exploding cows! - to bring down the house.  And user-created levels provide additional challenge and value to an already fun game.  This one is a definite must-have!

reviewText: I love this game. It's been my default go to" game whenever I have some time to kill or just feel like blowing things up for no obvious reason. With the DLC installed
recommended: some of the storyline challenges are no easy task - there is no free run to the finish line.\n\nThe workshop adds a whole new layer of fun/challenge/wtf
hoursPlayed: with enough uploaded content to keep the game going for days. With "Create a game level" as one of the achievements
voteText: there is a lot of chaff in with the wheat; but a good explore of the workshop levels is hugely rewarding.\n\nI've found creating game levels for the workshop generally entertaining
helpfulPercent: whith a few small quirks that take a little getting used to [and are probably more indicative of my own lack of experience with making game levels
votesHelpful: than with this game in particular]. Above all
votesTotal: the game creator has been a brilliant place to escape to when I've had trouble getting through in-game levels
votesFunny: and just want to take a break for a while.\n\nOverall: an absolute favourite game
commentsCount: not especially complex but tremendous fun to play. Should be much better known than it is. Highly recommended
column16: especially for the fan of blowing stuff up."

reviewText:
I started playing this about a year ago on my tablet. I passed on the PS3 version because I wasn't sure if it was worth the money just to play it on a bigger screen.

After seeing it dirt cheap in the Steam sale though, I thought I'd get it again, and I'm very glad I did.

It's not going to change your life, or eclipse all you have played before it, but what I like about it is that it's quirky and fun. It's one of those games that aren't to demanding on your concentration or brainpower either - perfect as I've got a heavy cold at the moment.

It has level designer and workshop integration so you can share new levels etc.

Definitely worth a try.
